task.summary: Default task

Add initial implementation of core OptiX framework
This commit introduces foundational components for the OptiX framework, including utility functions, base classes (e.g., `OXObject`, `OXVariable`), and test coverage for these modules. Additionally, it sets up project structure with `pyproject.toml`, `.gitignore`, and IntelliJ IDEA settings.

Add OXData and query functionality enhancements
Introduce `OXData` class for scenario-driven data handling with dynamic attributes based on active scenarios. Refactor the query functionality from `OXVariableSet` to `OXObjectPot` for broader applicability across object collections. Add initial tests for `OXData` to ensure correct scenario creation, serialization, and deserialization behavior.

Add support for constraints and expressions frameworks
Introduced foundational classes for defining mathematical constraints (`OXConstraint`, `OXGoalConstraint`) and expressions (`OXpression`) essential for problem modeling. These classes handle relational operators, deviations, and conversion between fractional and integer forms. This is a groundwork addition for robust constraint-based problem-solving.

Add OXProblem structure and improve querying functionality
Introduced the OXProblem class hierarchy, including OXLPProblem and OXGPProblem, to handle problem definitions in the system. Enhanced querying logic by moving it from OXObjectPot to OXVariableSet and replacing it with a `get_object_types` method in OXObjectPot for cleaner modularity. These changes improve problem-solving capabilities and data retrieval precision.

Add constraint creation and retrieval methods to OXProblem
Introduce `create_constraint` for flexible constraint creation with validation, using variables, weights, and operators. Add `__getitem__` for accessing constraints by UUID. Also, define `ObjectiveType` for clear objective function types.

Add new methods for variable, constraint, and objective handling
Introduce `create_variables_from_db`, `create_objective_function`, and `_check_parameters` to enhance flexibility in variable, constraint, and objective processing. Added goal constraint management via `create_goal_constraint` in `OXGPProblem`. Refactored related methods for better reusability and error handling.

Add comprehensive documentation and initial project setup
Introduce detailed docstrings across various classes and functions to enhance code readability and understanding. Add new files such as README.md, CHANGELOG.md, and CONTRIBUTING.md to document project guidelines, usage, and changelog history. Update dependencies and tooling in pyproject.toml for better development experience.

Add Sphinx documentation structure for OptiX
Set up Sphinx for documentation generation, including configuration, makefiles, and project structure. Added essential `.rst` files for usage, installation, contributing, and changelog, along with `.gitignore` for ignoring build artifacts. Includes support for auto-generating API documentation.

Update dependencies in pyproject.toml and organize dev tools
Moved development dependencies to main dependencies section for consistency and clarity. Updated versions for `sphinx`, `myst-parser`, and related tools to reflect new standards. This improves dependency management and ensures compatibility.

Refactor problem classes and add corresponding tests
Renamed and modularized problem classes into `OXCSPProblem`, `OXLPProblem`, and `OXGPProblem` with added functionality for constraints and objective functions. Simplified variable creation logic and added validation for parameters. Included unit tests to validate database-driven variable creation and error handling.

Add UML diagram for project structure
Introduce a UML diagram to visually represent the project's class structure and relationships. This aids in understanding the system architecture and facilitates future development efforts.

Add OXSpecialConstraints with various constraint types
Introduce a new module `OXSpecialConstraints.py` containing specialized constraint classes like `OXNonLinearEqualityConstraint`, `OXMultiplicativeEqualityConstraint`, `OXDivisionEqualityConstraint`, `OXModuloEqualityConstraint`, `OXSummationEqualityConstraint`, and `OXConditionalConstraint`. These classes extend the existing constraint framework to support more complex problem definitions.

Add special constraint creation methods and update OXObjectPot
Implemented new functions for creating various special constraints such as MultiplicativeEquality, DivisionEquality, ModulusEquality, SummationEquality, and ConditionalConstraint. Updated OXObjectPot to include methods for retrieving the last and first objects in the list.

Add special constraint creation methods and update OXProblem structure
Implemented functions for creating various special constraints including MultiplicativeEquality, DivisionEquality, ModulusEquality, SummationEquality, and ConditionalConstraint. Updated the OXProblem class to support these new constraints and improved the decision variable creation process.
Add unit tests for OXception, OXConstraint, and OXSpecialConstraints
Add OXSolverInterface class with methods for variable and constraint management
Add OXSolverInterface enhancements and XML configuration files
Add OXORToolsSolverInterface implementation for variable and constraint management
Add OXORToolsSolverInterface implementation for variable and constraint management
Enhance documentation and styling for OptiX framework with modern design elements
Update project configuration and enhance Gurobi solver with new constraint types

Add UML diagram for project structure
Introduce a UML diagram to visually represent the project's class structure and relationships. This aids in understanding the system architecture and facilitates future development efforts.

Add OXSpecialConstraints with various constraint types
Introduce a new module `OXSpecialConstraints.py` containing specialized constraint classes like `OXNonLinearEqualityConstraint`, `OXMultiplicativeEqualityConstraint`, `OXDivisionEqualityConstraint`, `OXModuloEqualityConstraint`, `OXSummationEqualityConstraint`, and `OXConditionalConstraint`. These classes extend the existing constraint framework to support more complex problem definitions.
Add `OXSpecialConstraint` and update `OXCSPProblem` for specialized constraints

Add SpecialConstraintType Enum to OXCSPProblem
Introduce `SpecialConstraintType` as an enumeration within the `OXCSPProblem` class to categorize specialized constraints. This addition enhances the framework's flexibility by supporting various constraint types like MultiplicativeEquality, DivisionEquality, ModulusEquality, SummationEquality, and ConditionalConstraint. This change aligns with recent enhancements in constraint handling and supports more complex problem definitions.
